overview:
For more than 35 years Mr. Dalton served in a senior executive capacity and as an entrepreneur in the information technology and financial industry. As a founder, Chairman and CEO of Fiserv, Inc., Mr. Dalton grew the company from its foundation as a regional provider with $14 million in revenues into a worldwide organization by identifying, acquiring and assimilating over 90 companies during his sixteen-year tenure. Today, Fiserv is a $4.7 billion enterprise with 16,000 clients in more than 60 countries supported by over 20,000 employees.

Upon retirement in March of 2000, Mr. Dalton went on to form NOVO 1 where he continued his entrepreneurial flair. With a high profile whoâ€™s who list of private investors and an experienced management team, this innovative, new direct marketing services firm has grown from start-up through 15 acquisitions to employ over 2,000 people and generate annualized revenues of approximately $70 million. NOVO 1 operations include specialized call-centers nationwide delivering customer care and acquisition services to over 400 clients that include new business start-ups to Fortune 500 companies primarily in the financial, telecom, healthcare, technology, professional services, and other growth industries.

Mr. Dalton serves as the 2009 Honorary Chairman of the Vince Lombardi Charitable Funds, a Director of the Milwaukee School of Engineering, Pier Wisconsin, The Waukesha County Action Network, United Way, the Wisconsin Humane Society and Wisconsin Wireless, all of Greater Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
